headline: Rebecca Harbowy, missing since November 2023, has died: RCMP
context: A woman who had been missing since security escorted her out of Ridge Meadows Hospital in November 2023 is deceased, according to RCMP.

The Ridge Meadows detachment provided few details in an update on the case Friday, saying only that then-36-year-old Maple Ridge resident Rebecca Harbowy was last seen “walking east on the Haney Bypass at Burnett Street” around 2:05 a.m. on Nov. 23, 2023.

annotations.paragraph: She was reported missing that same day.
annotations.reason: This provides a timeline detail relevant to the disappearance.

annotations.paragraph: Police did not say where or when Harbowy was confirmed dead, nor how she died.
annotations.reason: This highlights the lack of details about her death, which is relevant to the case.

annotations.paragraph: “No further information will be provided at this time,” a Ridge Meadows RCMP news release reads.
annotations.reason: This indicates the current status of information release from the authorities.

annotations.paragraph: In December 2023, Harbowy’s mother and sister spoke to CTV News about her disappearance and their frustration with health officials who allowed her to be discharged from the hospital.
annotations.reason: This provides context about family concerns and the circumstances of her hospital discharge.

annotations.paragraph: Rebecca Harbowy had a drug addiction and was trying to detox at her parents’ home, where she lived, according to her family.
annotations.reason: This gives background on Harbowy's personal struggles, relevant to her disappearance.

annotations.paragraph: “That afternoon, she became very confused and disorientated and was saying strange things and not making sense,” said Debbie Harbowy, Rebecca’s mother, at the time.
annotations.reason: Provides context about Rebecca's condition before she went missing.

annotations.paragraph: An ambulance was called, and after paramedics checked her over, Rebecca was taken to Ridge Meadows Hospital.
annotations.reason: Details the events leading to her being at the hospital.

annotations.paragraph: “The night doctor told me she would be admitted and be there for a minimum of three days,” said Debbie.
annotations.reason: Provides information on the expected hospital stay, relevant to her disappearance.

annotations.paragraph: Instead, after an incident between Rebecca and a health-care worker – which the family said involved Rebecca throwing a container of apple juice at a nurse – she was escorted out of the hospital and off the property by security.
annotations.reason: Explains the circumstances under which she left the hospital.

annotations.paragraph: She had no coat, no phone, no wallet and no money, according to her family.
annotations.reason: Highlights her vulnerable state when she went missing.

annotations.paragraph: “She didn’t go in a homeless person,” said Rachel Bertoia, Rebecca’s sister.
annotations.reason: This quote from Rebecca's sister provides personal context and emotional impact related to the case.

annotations.paragraph: “She came in from an ambulance with someone who loves her. Why would they think it’s OK to leave someone on the side of the road without anything, without anyone? At 1:30 in the morning, a woman, a 36-year-old woman, they didn’t even care to call her a cab. It’s infuriating.”
annotations.reason: This quote adds emotional context and criticism of the hospital's actions, relevant to the circumstances of Rebecca's disappearance.

annotations.paragraph: Police said the investigation into Harbowy’s death is “active,” and they encourage anyone with information that could help further the investigation to call 604-463-6251 and reference file number 2023-23402.
annotations.reason: This provides current information about the status of the investigation and a call to action for the public.

annotations.paragraph: “The RCMP extends our condolences to the family and friends of Rebecca Harbowy,” the release reads. “The Ridge Meadows RCMP would also like to thank the public, community partners and volunteers for their assistance with this investigation thus far.”
annotations.reason: This is a standard condolence message and thanks, which does not add new information to the story.

annotations.paragraph: With files from CTV News Vancouver’s Michele Brunoro
